query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 «Vergine Madre, figlia del tuo figlio, 2 umile e alta più che creatura, 3 termine fisso d’etterno consiglio,
query.error: **English:** 1 Virgin Mother, daughter of your Son, 2 humble and exalted more than any other creature, 3 fixed term of eternal counsel,
query.result: 1 Mægð and modor, ðines suna dohtor, 2 eaðmod and upheah ofer ealle gesceafta, 3 endebyrdnys eces rædes,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 tu se’ colei che l’umana natura 5 nobilitasti sì, che ’l suo fattore 6 non disdegnò di farsi sua fattura.
query.error: **English:** 4 you are the one who ennobled human nature 5 so much that its Maker 6 did not disdain to become its creature.
query.result: 4 ðu eart seo ðe ðone menniscan stefn 5 swa awurðodest ðæt ðines Scyppendes 6 ne ascunode ðæt he ðinne Scyppend wære.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 Nel ventre tuo si raccese l’amore, 8 per lo cui caldo ne l’etterna pace 9 così è germinato questo fiore.
query.error: **English:** 7 In your womb love was rekindled, 8 through whose warmth in eternal peace 9 this flower has thus germinated.
query.result: 7 On ðinum innoðe ða lufe wearð onæled, 8 ðurh ðæs hætan on ðam ecan sibbe 9 ðeos blostm gewearð ðus geboren.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Qui se’ a noi meridïana face 11 di caritate, e giuso, intra ’ mortali, 12 se’ di speranza fontana vivace.
query.error: **English:** 10 Here you are to us a noonday face 11 of charity, and down below, among mortals, 12 you are a living fountain of hope.
query.result: 10 Her ðu eart us on midne dæg 11 mildheortnesse, and niðer, betwux ða deadlican, 12 ðu eart wætres wyllspringa lyfes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Donna, se’ tanto grande e tanto vali, 14 che qual vuol grazia e a te non ricorre, 15 sua disïanza vuol volar sanz’ ali.
query.error: **English:** 13 Lady, if you are so great and so worthy, 14 that whoever wants grace and does not resort to you, 15 his desire wants to fly without wings.
query.result: 13 Hlæfdige, gif ðu eart swa micel and swa mærðum, 14 ðæt se ðe wille græne and to ðe ne cymeð, 15 his unðanc wille fleogan butan fiðrum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 La tua benignità non pur soccorre 17 a chi domanda, ma molte fïate 18 liberamente al dimandar precorre.
query.error: **English:** 16 Your kindness not only helps 17 those who ask, but many times 18 freely anticipates the request.
query.result: 16 ðin arfæstnes ne gefultumath ðone 17 ðe ðe biddeth, ac ðu fela siðe 18 freolice ðam biddendum togeanes cyrrest.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 In te misericordia, in te pietate, 20 in te magnificenza, in te s’aduna 21 quantunque in creatura è di bontate.
query.error: **English:** 19 In you is mercy, in you is pity, 20 in you is magnificence, in you is gathered 21 whatever goodness there is in creation.
query.result: 19 On ðe mildheortnes, on ðe mildheortnes, 20 on ðe mærðe, on ðe mærðe, on ðe mærðe, 21 eall ðæt gōd is on gesceaftum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Or questi, che da l’infima lacuna 23 de l’universo infin qui ha vedute 24 le vite spiritali ad una ad una,
query.error: **English:** 22 Now this man, who from the lowest depths 23 of the universe has seen up to here 24 the spiritual lives one by one,
query.result: 22 Nu ðes, ðe of ðære læstan lægan 23 ðæs woruldrīces oð ðis geseah 24 ða gastlican lif ænne æfter anum,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 supplica a te, per grazia, di virtute 26 tanto, che possa con li occhi levarsi 27 più alto verso l’ultima salute.
query.error: **English:** 25 begs you, as a favor, for so much virtue 26 that he may be able to raise his eyes 27 higher toward the ultimate salvation.
query.result: 25 biddeð ðe, ðurh ðine miltse, ðære mihte 26 ðæt he mæge ðurh ða eagan ahebban 27 heahor ufor ðone æftemestan hælo.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 E io, che mai per mio veder non arsi 29 più ch’i’ fo per lo suo, tutti miei prieghi 30 ti porgo, e priego che non sieno scarsi,
query.error: **English:** 28 And I, who never burned for my own sake 29 more than I do for his, offer you all my prayers, 30 and I beg that they not be meager,
query.result: 28 And ic, ðe næfre for minum gesyhðe ne byrnde 29 má ðonne ic dó for his, ealle míne béna 30 ic ðe beóde, and bidde ðæt hí ne síen gescyrte,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 perché tu ogne nube li disleghi 32 di sua mortalità co’ prieghi tuoi, 33 sì che ’l sommo piacer li si dispieghi.
query.error: **English:** 31 so that you may dispel every cloud 32 of his mortality with your prayers, 33 so that the highest pleasure may be revealed to him.
query.result: 31 forðæm ðe ðu ælce wolc him tóslíte 32 his deadlícnysse mid ðínum bénam, 33 swá ðæt ðæt héhste gefea him síe átywed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Ancor ti priego, regina, che puoi 35 ciò che tu vuoli, che conservi sani, 36 dopo tanto veder, li affetti suoi.
query.error: **English:** 34 Still I pray thee, O queen, who canst 35 whatever thou wilt, that thou preserve his affections sound, 36 after so much seeing.
query.result: 34 Ic ðe bidde gyt, ðu mæg ðæt ðu wille, 35 ðæt ðu gehealde ðæs mannes hyge gesunde, 36 æfter ðam miclan gesyhðe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Vinca tua guardia i movimenti umani: 38 vedi Beatrice con quanti beati 39 per li miei prieghi ti chiudon le mani!».
query.error: **English:** 37 Let your protection conquer human movements: 38 see Beatrice with how many blessed ones 39 close their hands for you because of my prayers!”.
query.result: 37 Þin heald gebeorge mannes modgeþonc: 38 geseoh Beatričan mid hu mænige blædum 39 ðurh mine bene ðe honda fæðmiað!”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 Li occhi da Dio diletti e venerati, 41 fissi ne l’orator, ne dimostraro 42 quanto i devoti prieghi le son grati;
query.error: **English:** 40 Her eyes, beloved and revered by God, 41 fixed on the one praying, showed 42 how pleasing to her are devout prayers;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 indi a l’etterno lume s’addrizzaro, 44 nel qual non si dee creder che s’invii 45 per creatura l’occhio tanto chiaro.
query.error: **English:** 43 then they turned to the eternal light, 44 into which it is not to be believed that 45 the eye, however clear, can penetrate
query.result: 43 ða wendon ða to ðam ecan leohte, 44 on ðam ðe man ne mæg gelyfan ðæt mæge 45 ðurh gesceaft ðæt eage ðæs ðe beorhtre sy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 E io ch’al fine di tutt’ i disii 47 appropinquava, sì com’ io dovea, 48 l’ardor del desiderio in me finii.
query.error: **English:** 46 And I, who was approaching the end of all desires, 47 just as I should have, 48 the ardor of desire ended in me.
query.result: 46 And ic ðe to ðæs ende ealra wilna 47 genealæhte, swa swa ic sceolde, 48 ðæs wilnunga wylm on me ge-endode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Bernardo m’accennava, e sorridea, 50 perch’ io guardassi suso; ma io era 51 già per me stesso tal qual ei volea:
query.error: **English:** 49 Bernard motioned to me and smiled, 50 so that I would look up; but I was already 51 by myself just as he wanted:
query.result: 49 Beornard me tæhte and smælde, 50 ðæt ic sceolde uppan locian; ac ic wæs 51 ða ðurh me sylf swylc he wolde:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 ché la mia vista, venendo sincera, 53 e più e più intrava per lo raggio 54 de l’alta luce che da sé è vera.
query.error: **English:** 52 for my sight, becoming pure, 53 entered more and more into the ray 54 of the high light that is true in itself.
query.result: 52 ðæt min gesiho, ðurh ðæt hit wæs clæne, 53 and mare and mare eode ðurh ðone leoman 54 ðæs hean leohtes ðe of him sylfum soð is.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Da quinci innanzi il mio veder fu maggio 56 che ’l parlar mostra, ch’a tal vista cede, 57 e cede la memoria a tanto oltraggio.
query.error: **English:** 55 From here on, my sight was greater 56 than speech can show, which fails before such a sight, 57 and memory fails before such an outrage.
query.result: 55 Of ðonon wæs min gesihð maran 56 ðonne ænig mon mæge mid muðe gecyðan, 57 and ðæs ofermægnes min mod gewat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Qual è colüi che sognando vede, 59 che dopo ’l sogno la passione impressa 60 rimane, e l’altro a la mente non riede,
query.error: **English:** 58 Such is the man who sees in a dream, 59 that after the dream the impression of the passion 60 remains, and the rest does not return to the mind,
query.result: 58 Swylc is se ðe on swefne gesihð, 59 ðæt æfter ðam swefne ðære gesyhðe last 60 geliðeð, and ðæt oðer ðære mode ne cymeð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 cotal son io, ché quasi tutta cessa 62 mia visïone, e ancor mi distilla 63 nel core il dolce che nacque da essa.
query.error: **English:** 61 such am I, for almost all of my vision 62 fades away, and still my heart distills 63 the sweetness that was born from it.
query.result: 61 swylc eom ic, ðæt nealæce eal gewit 62 min gesyhð, and ðeah ðæt swæte ðurhwunað 63 on ðam heortan ðe ðær of acenned wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Così la neve al sol si disigilla; 65 così al vento ne le foglie levi 66 si perdea la sentenza di Sibilla.
query.error: **English:** 64 Thus the snow melts in the sun; 65 thus in the wind among the light leaves 66 the Sibyl's prophecy was lost.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 O somma luce che tanto ti levi 68 da’ concetti mortali, a la mia mente 69 ripresta un poco di quel che parevi,
query.error: **English:** 67 O supreme light, who dost so far transcend 68 mortal conceptions, to my mind restore 69 a little of what thou didst appear,
query.result: 67 Eala, ðu mæste leoht ðe ðu swa feor ðe hefest 68 fram ðæra deadlicra ðohta, minum mode 69 geunne lytle hwæne ðæs ðe ðu ðuhte,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 e fa la lingua mia tanto possente, 71 ch’una favilla sol de la tua gloria 72 possa lasciare a la futura gente;
query.error: **English:** 70 and make my tongue so potent, 71 that it may leave to future generations 72 a single spark of thy glory;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 ché, per tornare alquanto a mia memoria 74 e per sonare un poco in questi versi, 75 più si conceperà di tua vittoria.
query.error: **English:** 73 for, by returning somewhat to my memory 74 and sounding it a little in these verses, 75 more will be conceived of thy victory.
query.result: 73 forðæm ðe, ðurh ðæt ðe ic wille hweorfan sumu to minum gemynde 74 and hlynsian lytle hwæne on ðisum leoðum, 75 ðonne mæg man mare oncnawan ðine sige.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Io credo, per l’acume ch’io soffersi 77 del vivo raggio, ch’i’ sarei smarrito, 78 se li occhi miei da lui fossero aversi.
query.error: **English:** 76 I believe that because of the sharpness which I suffered 77 from the living ray, I would have been lost, 78 if my eyes had been turned away from it.
query.result: 76 Ic gelyfe, ðurh ðone sceaðan ðe ic ðolode 77 ðæs lyfigendan leoman, ðæt ic forloren wäre, 78 gif mine eagan fram him awende wæron.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 E’ mi ricorda ch’io fui più ardito 80 per questo a sostener, tanto ch’i’ giunsi 81 l’aspetto mio col valore infinito.
query.error: **English:** 79 And it reminds me that I was more bold 80 because of this to endure, so that I reached 81 my appearance with infinite value.
query.result: 79 And hit gemint ðæt ic wæs ðæs geornor 80 ðurh ðis to ðolianne, swa ðæt ic becom 81 min ansyn mid ðam unimetanlican weorðe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Oh abbondante grazia ond’ io presunsi 83 ficcar lo viso per la luce etterna, 84 tanto che la veduta vi consunsi!
query.error: **English:** 82 O abundant grace, through which I presumed 83 to fix my gaze on the eternal light, 84 so that my sight was consumed by it!
query.result: 82 O ðu micel mildheortnes ðurh ða ic ðorfte 83 fæstan ðone gesihð ðurh ða ecan leoht, 84 swa ðæt ðin gesiho ðær on forwearð!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Nel suo profondo vidi che s’interna, 86 legato con amore in un volume, 87 ciò che per l’universo si squaderna:
query.error: **English:** 85 In its depths I saw that it contains, 86 bound together with love in a single volume, 87 all that is dispersed throughout the universe:
query.result: 85 On ðære ðiopanesse ic ða geseah ðæt ðær wæs innan, 86 gebunden mid ðære lufe on anum bocum, 87 ðæt ðæt ðurh ðone ealldor ðurhspret:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 sustanze e accidenti e lor costume 89 quasi conflati insieme, per tal modo 90 che ciò ch’i’ dico è un semplice lume.
query.error: **English:** 88 substances and accidents and their properties, 89 as if fused together, in such a way 90 that what I say is a mere glimmer.
query.result: 88 ða gesceaftas and ða gesetnyssa and heora ðeawas, 89 swa swa ða togædere gemencgede, ðurh ðone wisan 90 ðæt ðæt ðæt ic secge is anfeald leoht.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 La forma universal di questo nodo 92 credo ch’i’ vidi, perché più di largo, 93 dicendo questo, mi sento ch’i’ godo.
query.error: **English:** 91 The universal form of this knot 92 I believe that I saw, because more broadly, 93 saying this, I feel that I rejoice.
query.result: 91 Þæs cnottes gecyndelice hiw 92 ic wene ðæt ic gesawe, for ðan ðe mare, 93 ðis secgende, me ðincð ðæt ic gelyfe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Un punto solo m’è maggior letargo 95 che venticinque secoli a la ’mpresa 96 che fé Nettuno ammirar l’ombra d’Argo.
query.error: **English:** 94 A single moment of sleep is more refreshing to me 95 than twenty-five centuries of the enterprise 96 that made Neptune admire the shadow of Argo.
query.result: 94 An ænig punt mæ is mara slæp 95 ðonne fif and twentig wintra ðære wæpnedmen 96 ðe Nettunus ongan niwan ðæs scipes sceaðu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Così la mente mia, tutta sospesa, 98 mirava fissa, immobile e attenta, 99 e sempre di mirar faceasi accesa.
query.error: **English:** 97 Thus my mind, all in suspense, 98 gazed fixedly, motionless and intent, 99 and ever grew more kindled with desire to see.
query.result: 97 Swa min mod georn, eal forworden, 98 wæs fæste befangen, stið and staðol, 99 and symle iucor æfre geornor wæs to geseonne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 A quella luce cotal si diventa, 101 che volgersi da lei per altro aspetto 102 è impossibil che mai si consenta;
query.error: **English:** 100 In that light one becomes such 101 that to turn away from it for another sight 102 is impossible, and no one would ever consent to do so;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 però che ’l ben, ch’è del volere obietto, 104 tutto s’accoglie in lei, e fuor di quella 105 è defettivo ciò ch’è lì perfetto.
query.error: **English:** 103 because the good, which is the object of desire, 104 is all gathered in it, and outside of it 105 that which is perfect there is defective.
query.result: 103 forðæm ðe ðæt god, ðe is ðæs willan andwlita, 104 eall hit is gegaderod on ðære leohte, and buton ðære leohte 105 ðæt ðær is fulfremed bið gebrec.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Omai sarà più corta mia favella, 107 pur a quel ch’io ricordo, che d’un fante 108 che bagni ancor la lingua a la mammella.
query.error: **English:** 106 Oh, my speech will be shorter, 107 only to what I remember, than that of a child 108 who still wets his tongue at the breast.
query.result: 106 Oððe minre spræce bið sciortre, 107 buton ðam ðe ic gemæne, ðonne ðæs cnihtes 108 ðe ða gyt ða tungan weteð on ðære breoste.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Non perché più ch’un semplice sembiante 110 fosse nel vivo lume ch’io mirava, 111 che tal è sempre qual s’era davante;
query.error: **English:** 109 Not because there was anything more than a simple image 110 in the living light that I was gazing at, 111 for it is always the same as it was before;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 ma per la vista che s’avvalorava 113 in me guardando, una sola parvenza, 114 mutandom’ io, a me si travagliava.
query.error: **English:** 112 but because my sight, as I gazed at it, 113 grew stronger, a single image, 114 as I changed, was transformed for me.
query.result: 112 ac for ðære gesihðe ðe on me strangode, 113 on me locian, anlicnes ane, 114 me onwendendum, me onhyrde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Ne la profonda e chiara sussistenza 116 de l’alto lume parvermi tre giri 117 di tre colori e d’una contenenza;
query.error: **English:** 115 In the profound and clear subsistence 116 of the high light, three circles appeared to me 117 of three colors and of one content;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 e l’un da l’altro come iri da iri 119 parea reflesso, e ’l terzo parea foco 120 che quinci e quindi igualmente si spiri.
query.error: **English:** 118 and one from the other, like iris from iris, 119 seemed reflected, and the third seemed fire 120 that equally breathes forth from here and there.
query.result: 118 and ðæt an ðurh ðæt oðer, swa iris ðurh iris, 119 ðuhte befangen, and ðæt ðridde ðuhte fyr 120 ðe on ægðre healfe efenlice blæseð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Oh quanto è corto il dire e come fioco 122 al mio concetto! e questo, a quel ch’i’ vidi, 123 è tanto, che non basta a dicer ‘poco’.
query.error: **English:** 121 Oh, how short and weak is speech 122 compared to my conception! And this, compared to what I saw, 123 is so much that it is not enough to say ‘little’.
query.result: 121 Eala, hu micel is ðæt to secganne and hu lyt 122 to ðam ðe ic ðær geseah, and ðæt ðuhte ða ðeah 123 swa micel ðæt ic hit ne mæg asecgan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 O luce etterna che sola in te sidi, 125 sola t’intendi, e da te intelletta 126 e intendente te ami e arridi!
query.error: **English:** 124 O eternal light that alone abidest in thyself, 125 alone understandest thyself, and from thyself 126 understanding and understood dost love and smile upon thyself!
query.result: 124 E ðu ece leoht ðe ðu ana ðe sylfa wunast, 125 ðu ðe ana ðe sylfa gecnawest, and of ðe sylfa 126 gecnawen ðe sylfa lufast and ðe sylfa blistast!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Quella circulazion che sì concetta 128 pareva in te come lume reflesso, 129 da li occhi miei alquanto circunspetta,
query.error: **English:** 127 That circling motion which appeared to be conceived 128 in thee as reflected light, 129 somewhat cautiously observed by my eyes,
query.result: 127 Se ylca ymbhwyrft ðe ðuhte ðær on ðe geðoht 128 swa swa leoht on ðære wederleoman, 129 ðurh ða eagan mine ða ðær waron ðæs fægeran gesceafte,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 dentro da sé, del suo colore stesso, 131 mi parve pinta de la nostra effige: 132 per che ’l mio viso in lei tutto era messo.
query.error: **English:** 130 within itself, of its own color, 131 seemed to me painted with our human form: 132 because of which my sight was wholly absorbed in it.
query.result: 130 binnan him sylfum, of his agenre hiwe, 131 ðuhte ðær awriten mid ure agenre ansyne: 132 for ðæm ðin ansyn wæs ðær eall on asend.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Qual è ’l geomètra che tutto s’affige 134 per misurar lo cerchio, e non ritrova, 135 pensando, quel principio ond’ elli indige,
query.error: **English:** 133 Like the geometer who sets himself entirely 134 to measure the circle, and finds not, 135 thinking, that principle from which he needs to begin,
query.result: 133 Swylce se geomætre ðe eallunga hine sylfne befehð 134 to gemetenne ðone circl, and ne fint, 135 ðencende, ðone fruman of ðam ðe he ðearf ðæt he ðanon onginne,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 tal era io a quella vista nova: 137 veder voleva come si convenne 138 l’imago al cerchio e come vi s’indova;
query.error: **English:** 136 such was I at that new sight: 137 I wanted to see how the image fitted 138 into the circle and how it was placed there;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 ma non eran da ciò le proprie penne: 140 se non che la mia mente fu percossa 141 da un fulgore in che sua voglia venne.
query.error: **English:** 139 but my own wings were not enough for that: 140 until my mind was struck 141 by a flash of light in which its desire was fulfilled.
query.result: 139 ac ða næron ða sylfan fideru ðærto genihtsume: 140 buton ðæt min mod wæs mid ligette ofslægen, 141 on ðam ðe his willa com.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 A l’alta fantasia qui mancò possa; 143 ma già volgeva il mio disio e ’l velle, 144 sì come rota ch’igualmente è mossa,
query.error: **English:** 142 At the lofty fantasy here failed the power; 143 but already my desire and will were turning, 144 like a wheel that is moved evenly,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 l’amor che move il sole e l’altre stelle.
query.error: **English:** 145 by the love that moves the sun and the other stars.
query.result: 145 ðurh ða lufe ðe styreð ða sunnan and ða oðre steorran.
